current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To provide for the treatment of certain hospitals under the Medicare program.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Fair Competition for Hospitals Act of 2013
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Fair Competition for Hospitals Act of 2013

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the
			 wage index that applies to such hospital under such section shall be the
			 highest wage index assigned to hospitals in the core-based statistical area in
			 which the hospital is located (regardless of which State the hospital is
			 located in) as a result of the application of
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Fair Competition for Hospitals Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a/p:2

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any
			 other provision of law, effective for discharges occurring on or after October
			 1, 2014, for purposes of making payments under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 1886(d) of the Social
			 Security Act

section 4410(a) of the Balanced
			 Budget Act of 1997

text.#text:
A hospital described in this paragraph is a
			 hospital—

that is not
			 located in a core-based statistical area in which 1 or more hospitals are
			 subject to the minimum wage index under paragraph (h)(4) of section 412.64 of
			 title 42, Code of Federal Regulations; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
applies to hospitals described in such paragraph
			 under a State reimbursement system under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Fair Competition for Hospitals Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a/p:1

text.#text:
that is not
			 located in a core-based statistical area in which the highest wage index
			 described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Fair Competition for Hospitals Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

text.#text:
Any
			 increase in the wage index of a hospital as a result of the application of
